sentences.sentence: Syrian refugees living in earthquake hit Turkey rush to return home as border crossings reopen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Still not budging, the NATO Secretary General urges Turkey to allow Sweden and Finland to join the military alliance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's President Zelensky says Bakhmut will stand firm against relentless Russian attacks, while Moscow claims its troops are gaining ground.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Some 1,000 pro-Russian protesters rallied in Belgrade on Wednesday to decry President Vucic's call for sanctions against Moscow. This is one of the border crossings the Syrian regime agreed to open so that aid can enter Syria and reach some of the areas affected by those quakes last week. And as you can see, trucks are not the only thing going in.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Over there, there are dozens of Syrian families waiting for a chance to go back to their home country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Some have been saying they had been here in Turkey for several years, but that their homes here also got destroyed in this tragedy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Many say their priority right now is to go back and try to reach loved ones who may be wounded, who may have been lost in this disaster, and see if anything from their previous lives is still standing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Jamal is 55 and from Idlib. Like most people here, Jamal left Syria for a chance of a better life in Turkey several years ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Last week's earthquake destroyed the little these people managed to build anew and is offering them an impossible choice between staying in a disaster zone or going back to a war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Annelies Borges on the Turkish-Syrian border for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A haven of hope for a country with an overwhelmed health system.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This field hospital was set up by French doctors and relief workers in the Turkish town of Golbasi to treat the wounded.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: People like this injured man, who was caught in a coffee shop by the earthquake.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Le flux de patients est constant et les équipes d'urgence ne sont pas limitées à des victimes d'ont plus de médicaments. Donc on gère à la fois la phase aiguë de la catastrophe et derrière la phase plus, on va dire, plus dispensée, de surveillance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Les médecins et les rescuers sont en train de travailler à l'écart pour aider la population locale.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Et certains d'entre eux ont des liens personnels avec le pays.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Du fait que je sois né en Turquie, mais que je sois militaire français et de nationalité française, en tant que Français, I was born in Turkey but I am a French military man of French nationality.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: As a Frenchman, I am proud that France can help my native country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The help provided by the field hospital is crucial for its patients.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Some 41,000 people are dead after the February 6 quakes in Turkey and northern Syria, while millions are now displaced.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg has urged Turkey to ratify the applications of Finland and Sweden to the transatlantic military alliance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Ankara is blocking their membership, saying the two countries need to take a tougher line against Kurdish groups it considers to be terrorist organizations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: However, Stoltenberg said Stockholm and Helsinki were heading in the right direction.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They have removed any restrictions on arms exports, strengthened their legislation on terrorism, and Sweden is also amending their constitution and stepped up the cooperation with Turkey, also established a permanent mechanism to continue to work closely with Turkey in the fight against terrorism.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Turkey has said Sweden should not expect its support after recent anti-Islam protests were held in its capital, including one where a Koran was burned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: All NATO members must agree before a country can exceed the alliance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Russia claims to be making ground near the Ukrainian city of Bakhmut, albeit slowly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It is certainly inflicting damage in round-the-clock attacks there and on other positions in eastern Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: President Volodymyr Zelensky has called back our fortress, but citizens in the neighboring town of Chasuvyar are getting out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A minibus is picking up those who want to leave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's a little scary when there are arrivals, but I want to rest from the noise. We hope that the Armed Forces of Ukraine will be with us, defeat these URKs, kill them, and we will return. President Zelensky admitted the situation in the direction of Bakhmut is at the moment the hottest, but that the troops were standing firm.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile in the town of Povrozk in the Donetsk region, three civilians were killed and around a dozen more injured following Russian shelling on a five-storey apartment block.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Russia's costly military campaign in Ukraine has likely significantly depleted Russian equipment and manpower reserves necessary to sustain a successful large-scale offensive in eastern Ukraine, says the Institute for the Study of War. Russia's inability to regenerate expanded mechanized vehicles in the short term further restricts Russian maneuver warfare capabilities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Now, the International Institute for Strategic Studies reported that Russia lost about 50% of its T-72B and T-72B3M tanks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The timely Western provisions of tanks and armored vehicles to Ukraine would further offset Russia's ability to conduct mechanized warfare as Russia struggles to restart its defense production in the immediate term.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ukraine likely continues to have a window of opportunity to initiate large-scale counteroffensives over the next few months, but its ability to do so likely rests heavily on the speed and scale at which the West provides it with necessary material, particularly tanks and armored vehicles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: which the West provides it with necessary material, particularly tanks and armoured vehicles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Now, the UK Defence Ministry adds that across Russia, the airspace forces likely maintain a largely intact fleet of approximately 1,500 crewed military aircraft, despite losing over 130 since the start of the invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It is unlikely that the airspace forces are currently preparing for a dramatically expanded air campaign as under the current battlefield circumstances it would likely suffer unsustainable aircraft losses. Overall Russian air power continues to significantly underperform in the war constrained by a continued high threat from Ukrainian air defenses and dispersed basing due to the threat of strikes against Russian airfields. Russian combat jets operate almost exclusively over Russian held territory, preventing them from carrying out their key strike role effectively.

sentences.sentence: Thousands of people are on the streets in Marseille for 50 a protest against plans to raise France's retirement age from 62 to 64.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Police say that around 1 million people rallied across the country last weekend, although unions put that number closer to 2.5 million.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Thursday's protests are aiming to maintain momentum ahead of larger demonstrations on March 7th.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, parliamentary debates on the reform are entering their final stretch in the National Assembly.

sentences.sentence: Lawmakers will review the tax reform starting at midnight on Friday before sending it to the Senate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The president of the World Bank, David Malpass, has announced he will be stepping down almost a year before his term is set to end.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He has given no reason for his departure, but his tenure has been controversial.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Having previously served in the Trump administration, he has been criticized by politicians and climate activists for his stance on climate change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He is on record for saying he did not know if fossil fuels were driving climate change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He is on record for saying he did not know if fossil fuels were driving climate change. The World Bank, a group of 189 nations, lends money to developing countries to help reduce poverty.

sentences.sentence: Rare footage of the sunken cruise liner the Titanic has been released.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The images were taken during a 1986 diving expedition to examine the wreckage of the ship, a 1986 diving expedition to examine the wreckage of the ship, which sank in April 1912 during the ship's maiden voyage from Southampton, England to New York City. More than 1,500 of the 2,200 people on board died. The unseen footage is timed to coincide with the release of a remastered version of the award-winning blockbuster Titanic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Have 50 million euros lying around?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Well, then you could be the new owner of the oldest known Hebrew Bible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The 1,000-year-old text is going up for auction in New York in May.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: And its projected sale price could soon make it the most expensive historical document in the world, beating the cost of a first print of the U.S. Constitution that went for around 40 million euros.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: What you see behind you is a Bible written over a millennia ago, around the year 900, in the land of Israel or Syria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Before this, portions of the Bible had only appeared in Dead Sea Scrolls.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: And after the Dead Sea Scrolls, after that period, which ended around the first, second century of the Common Era, there are no book forms of the Bible, there's no biblical text until the year 900, the late ninth, early tenth century, when this Bible was written.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The ancient document has previously been owned by private collectors as well as academic and historical institutions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: When asked who could be its next buyer, Sotheby's said the list of interested parties was a bottomless pit.
